001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.EstimationFunction;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunction;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Optimizer;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Regime;
009
010/**
011 * A {@link Regime} decorator that repeats training for a fixed number of epochs.
012 *
013 * <p>This regime wraps another regime and delegates training to it multiple times.
014 * Each call to {@link #train} will invoke the delegate regime exactly
015 * {@link #getEpochs()} times over the same dataset. This is useful for
016 * composing training behaviors where you want to control how many epochs of
017 * training are performed independently of other concerns (batching, reporting,
018 * early stopping, etc.).</p>
019 *
020 * <h3>Notes</h3>
021 * <ul>
022 *   <li>The number of epochs must be at least 1.</li>
023 *   <li>This regime is typically used in a {@link net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes.ChainedRegime}
024 *   together with other decorators.</li>
025 * </ul>
026 *
027 * @see DelegatedRegime
028 */
029@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
030public final class EpochRegime extends DelegatedRegime implements EpochConfigurable {
031
032    /**
033     * Creates a new {@code EpochRegime} that delegates to the given regime
034     * and repeats training for the specified number of epochs.
035     *
036     * @param regime the underlying regime to delegate training to
037     * @param epochs the number of epochs to run (must be {@code >= 1})
038     */
039    public EpochRegime(Regime regime, int epochs) {
040        super(regime);
041        setHyperparameter(HP_EPOCHS, epochs);
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * Trains the given estimation function by repeatedly delegating to the
046     * wrapped regime for the configured number of epochs.
047     *
048     * @param estimationFunction the model to train
049     * @param trainingSet        the dataset to train on
050     * @param objective          the loss function to evaluate
051     * @param optimizer          the optimizer to apply parameter updates
052     * @param <E>                the type of estimation function
053     */
054    @Override
055    public <E extends EstimationFunction<Float>> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<Float> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective, Optimizer<? super E, Float> optimizer) {
056        for (int i = 0; i < getEpochs(); i++) {
057            regime.train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer);
058        }
059    }
060}
